Additionally, it's worth noting that the United Methodist Church is a global denomination, with members and congregations spanning many different regions and cultures. Different regions may have varying beliefs and practices, making it difficult to find a one-size-fits-all compromise.

While it's true that societal divisions and a lack of empathy can exacerbate theological differences, it's important to recognize that these schisms are the result of deeply held and widely varying beliefs, rather than a failure to compromise or empathize.
